x-intellij-enum-metadata.gradle-kmp: The file layout corresponds to the Gradle [Kotlin Multiplatform layout](https://kotlinlang.org/docs/multiplatform-discover-project.html#source-sets)
x-intellij-enum-metadata.gradle-jvm: The file layout corresponds to the standard Gradle [JVM layout](https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/organizing_gradle_projects.html)
x-intellij-enum-metadata.default: The [default Amper file layout](#project-layout) is used

description.x-intellij-html-description: Plugin description. Can be used by tooling to provide documentation on plugin references in configuration files.
description.title: Plugin description. Can be used by tooling to provide documentation on plugin references in configuration files

id.x-intellij-html-description: Plugin id that is going to be used to refer to the plugin in the configuration files
id.title: Plugin id that is going to be used to refer to the plugin in the configuration files

schemaExtensionClassName.x-intellij-html-description: Fully qualified name of the @Schema-annotated interface to be used as plugin configuration. This interface can't come from a dependency, it must be declared in the source directory.
schemaExtensionClassName.title: Fully qualified name of the @Schema-annotated interface to be used as plugin configuration. This interface can't come from a dependency, it must be declared in the source directory

platforms.x-intellij-html-description: What platforms to generate the product for
platforms.title: What platforms to generate the product for

x-intellij-enum-metadata.lib: A reusable library which could be used as dependency by other modules in the codebase
x-intellij-enum-metadata.jvm/app: A JVM console or desktop application

type.x-intellij-html-description: What type of product to generate
type.title: What type of product to generate

exported.x-intellij-html-description: Whether a dependency should be [visible as a part of a published API](#scopes-and-visibility)
exported.title: Whether a dependency should be visible as a part of a published API

scope.x-intellij-html-description: When the dependency should be used. Read more about the [dependency scopes](#scopes-and-visibility)
scope.title: When the dependency should be used. Read more about the dependency scopes

exported.x-intellij-html-description: Whether a dependency should be [visible as a part of a published API](#scopes-and-visibility)
exported.title: Whether a dependency should be visible as a part of a published API

scope.x-intellij-html-description: When the dependency should be used. Read more about the [dependency scopes](#scopes-and-visibility)
scope.title: When the dependency should be used. Read more about the dependency scopes

exported.x-intellij-html-description: Whether a dependency should be [visible as a part of a published API](#scopes-and-visibility)
exported.title: Whether a dependency should be visible as a part of a published API

scope.x-intellij-html-description: When the dependency should be used. Read more about the [dependency scopes](#scopes-and-visibility)
scope.title: When the dependency should be used. Read more about the dependency scopes

file.x-intellij-html-description: A relative path to a file with the credentials. Currently, only `*.property` files are supported
file.title: A relative path to a file with the credentials. Currently, only `*.property` files are supported

passwordKey.x-intellij-html-description: A key in the file that holds the password
passwordKey.title: A key in the file that holds the password

usernameKey.x-intellij-html-description: A key in the file that holds the username
usernameKey.title: A key in the file that holds the username

id.x-intellij-html-description: The ID of the repository, used for to reference it. Defaults to the repository url
id.title: The ID of the repository, used for to reference it. Defaults to the repository url

publish.x-intellij-html-description: Whether this repository can be used to publish artifacts
publish.title: Whether this repository can be used to publish artifacts

resolve.x-intellij-html-description: Whether this repository can be used to resolve artifacts
resolve.title: Whether this repository can be used to resolve artifacts

additionalAnnotations.x-intellij-html-description: The full-qualified name of additional annotations that should be considered as `@Parcelize`. This is useful if you need to annotate classes in common code shared between different platforms, where the real `@Parcelize` annotation is not available. In that case, create your own common annotation and add its fully-qualified name here so that Parcelize recognizes it.
additionalAnnotations.title: The full-qualified name of additional annotations that should be considered as `@Parcelize`. This is useful if you need to annotate classes in common code shared between different platforms, where the real `@Parcelize` annotation is not available. In that case, create your own common annotation and add its fully-qualified name here so that Parcelize recognizes it

enabled.x-intellij-html-description: Whether to enable [Parcelize](https://developer.android.com/kotlin/parcelize). When enabled, an implementation of the `Parcelable` interface is automatically generated for classes annotated with `@Parcelize`.
enabled.title: Whether to enable Parcelize. When enabled, an implementation of the `Parcelable` interface is automatically generated for classes annotated with `@Parcelize`

excludes.x-intellij-html-description:
The set of excluded patterns. Java resources matching any of these patterns do not get packaged in the APK.
Example: '**/*.md', 'META-INF/LICENSE.txt', etc.
excludes.title:
The set of excluded patterns. Java resources matching any of these patterns do not get packaged in the APK.
Example: '**/*.md', 'META-INF/LICENSE.txt', etc

merges.x-intellij-html-description:
The set of patterns for which matching java resources are merged. For each java resource APK entry path matching one of these patterns, all java resources with that path are concatenated and packaged as a single entry in the APK.
Example: '**/*.properties', 'META-INF/NOTICE.md', etc.
merges.title:
The set of patterns for which matching java resources are merged. For each java resource APK entry path matching one of these patterns, all java resources with that path are concatenated and packaged as a single entry in the APK.
Example: '**/*.properties', 'META-INF/NOTICE.md', etc

pickFirsts.x-intellij-html-description:
The set of patterns for which the first occurrence is packaged in the APK. For each java resource APK entry path matching one of these patterns, only the first java resource found with that path gets packaged in the APK.
Example: '**/*.version', 'META-INF/*.kotlin_module', etc.
pickFirsts.title:
The set of patterns for which the first occurrence is packaged in the APK. For each java resource APK entry path matching one of these patterns, only the first java resource found with that path gets packaged in the APK.
Example: '**/*.version', 'META-INF/*.kotlin_module', etc

propertiesFile.x-intellij-html-description: Properties file where the keystore data is stored.
propertiesFile.title: Properties file where the keystore data is stored

applicationId.x-intellij-html-description: The ID for the application on a device and in the Google Play Store. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/build/configure-app-module#set-namespace)
applicationId.title: The ID for the application on a device and in the Google Play Store

compileSdk.x-intellij-html-description: The API level to compile the code. The code can use only the Android APIs up to that API level. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/reference/tools/gradle-api/com/android/build/api/dsl/CommonExtension#compileSdk())
compileSdk.title: The API level to compile the code. The code can use only the Android APIs up to that API level. )

maxSdk.x-intellij-html-description: Maximum API level on which the application can run. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/uses-sdk-element.html)
maxSdk.title: Maximum API level on which the application can run

minSdk.x-intellij-html-description: Minimum API level needed to run the application. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/uses-sdk-element.html)
minSdk.title: Minimum API level needed to run the application

namespace.x-intellij-html-description: A Kotlin or Java package name for the generated `R` and `BuildConfig` classes. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/build/configure-app-module#set-namespace)
namespace.title: A Kotlin or Java package name for the generated `R` and `BuildConfig` classes

parcelize.x-intellij-html-description: Configure [Kotlin Parcelize](https://developer.android.com/kotlin/parcelize) to automatically implement the `Parcelable` interface for classes annotated with `@Parcelize`.
parcelize.title: Configure Kotlin Parcelize to automatically implement the `Parcelable` interface for classes annotated with `@Parcelize`

resourcePackaging.x-intellij-html-description: Packaging options for java resource files.
resourcePackaging.title: Packaging options for java resource files

targetSdk.x-intellij-html-description: The target API level for the application. [Read more](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/uses-sdk-element.html)
targetSdk.title: The target API level for the application

exposedAccessors.x-intellij-html-description: Whether the generated resources accessors should be exposed to other modules (public) or internal.
exposedAccessors.title: Whether the generated resources accessors should be exposed to other modules  or internal

packageName.x-intellij-html-description:
A unique identifier for the resources in the current module.
Used as package for the generated Res class and for isolating resources in the final artifact.
packageName.title:
A unique identifier for the resources in the current module.
Used as package for the generated Res class and for isolating resources in the final artifact

enabled.x-intellij-html-description: Enable Compose runtime, dependencies and the compiler plugins
enabled.title: Enable Compose runtime, dependencies and the compiler plugins

basename.x-intellij-html-description: The name of the generated framework
basename.title: The name of the generated framework

isStatic.x-intellij-html-description: Whether to create a dynamically linked or statically linked framework
isStatic.title: Whether to create a dynamically linked or statically linked framework

framework.x-intellij-html-description: (Only for the library [product type](#product-types) Configure the generated framework to [share the common code with an Xcode project](https://kotlinlang.org/docs/multiplatform-mobile-understand-project-structure.html#ios-framework)
framework.title: Configure the generated framework to share the common code with an Xcode project

teamId.x-intellij-html-description:
A Team ID is a unique string assigned to your team by Apple.
It's necessary if you want to run/test on a Apple device.
Read [how to locate your team ID in Xcode](https://developer.apple.com/help/account/manage-your-team/locate-your-team-id/), or use [KDoctor tool](https://github.com/Kotlin/kdoctor) (`kdoctor --team-ids`)
teamId.title:
A Team ID is a unique string assigned to your team by Apple.
It's necessary if you want to run/test on a Apple device.
Read how to locate your team ID in Xcode, or use KDoctor tool

processorOptions.x-intellij-html-description: Options to pass to annotation processors
processorOptions.title: Options to pass to annotation processors

processors.x-intellij-html-description: The list of annotation processors to use. Each item can be a path to a local module, a catalog reference, or maven coordinates
processors.title: The list of annotation processors to use. Each item can be a path to a local module, a catalog reference, or maven coordinates

freeJvmArgs.x-intellij-html-description: Pass any JVM command line arguments to the test process.
freeJvmArgs.title: Pass any JVM command line arguments to the test process

systemProperties.x-intellij-html-description: Pass JVM system properties to set for the test process.
systemProperties.title: Pass JVM system properties to set for the test process

mainClass.x-intellij-html-description: (Only for `jvm/app` [product type](#product-types)). The fully-qualified name of the class used to run the application
mainClass.title: The fully-qualified name of the class used to run the application

release.x-intellij-html-description: The minimum JVM release version that the code should be compatible with. This enforces compatibility on 3 levels. First, it is used as the target version for the bytecode generated from Kotlin and Java sources. Second, it limits the Java platform APIs available to Kotlin and Java sources. Third, it limits the Java language constructs in Java sources. If this is set to null, these constraints are not applied and the compiler defaults are used.
release.title: The minimum JVM release version that the code should be compatible with. This enforces compatibility on 3 levels. First, it is used as the target version for the bytecode generated from Kotlin and Java sources. Second, it limits the Java platform APIs available to Kotlin and Java sources. Third, it limits the Java language constructs in Java sources. If this is set to null, these constraints are not applied and the compiler defaults are used

runtimeClasspathMode.x-intellij-html-description: Specifies how runtime classpath is constructed for the application. The default is `jars`, which means all the dependencies including local dependencies on Amper modules will be built as jars. The `classes` mode will use classes for local modules as part of the runtime classpath.
runtimeClasspathMode.title: Specifies how runtime classpath is constructed for the application. The default is `jars`, which means all the dependencies including local dependencies on Amper modules will be built as jars. The `classes` mode will use classes for local modules as part of the runtime classpath

storeParameterNames.x-intellij-html-description: Enables storing formal parameter names of constructors and methods in the generated class files. These can later be accessed using reflection. Behind the scenes, this passes the '-parameters' option to the Java compiler, and the '-java-parameters' option to the Kotlin compiler.
storeParameterNames.title: Enables storing formal parameter names of constructors and methods in the generated class files. These can later be accessed using reflection. Behind the scenes, this passes the '-parameters' option to the Java compiler, and the '-java-parameters' option to the Kotlin compiler

annotations.x-intellij-html-description: List of annotations that trigger open class/method generation. Classes/methods annotated with these annotations will be automatically made open.
annotations.title: List of annotations that trigger open class/method generation. Classes/methods annotated with these annotations will be automatically made open

enabled.x-intellij-html-description: Enable the Kotlin all-open compiler plugin
enabled.title: Enable the Kotlin all-open compiler plugin

x-intellij-enum-metadata.spring: Automatically adds annotations used by the Spring framework
x-intellij-enum-metadata.micronaut: Automatically adds annotations used by the Micronaut framework
x-intellij-enum-metadata.quarkus: Automatically adds annotations used by the Quarkus framework

presets.x-intellij-html-description: Predefined sets of annotations for common frameworks. Each preset automatically includes annotations specific to that framework.
presets.title: Predefined sets of annotations for common frameworks. Each preset automatically includes annotations specific to that framework

processorOptions.x-intellij-html-description: Some options to pass to KSP processors. Refer to each processor documentation for details.
processorOptions.title: Some options to pass to KSP processors. Refer to each processor documentation for details

processors.x-intellij-html-description: The list of KSP processors to use. Each item can be a path to a local module, a catalog reference, or maven coordinates.
processors.title: The list of KSP processors to use. Each item can be a path to a local module, a catalog reference, or maven coordinates

version.x-intellij-html-description: The version of KSP to use
version.title: The version of KSP to use

annotations.x-intellij-html-description: List of annotations that trigger no-arg constructor generation. Classes annotated with these annotations will have a no-arg constructor generated.
annotations.title: List of annotations that trigger no-arg constructor generation. Classes annotated with these annotations will have a no-arg constructor generated

enabled.x-intellij-html-description: Enable the Kotlin no-arg compiler plugin
enabled.title: Enable the Kotlin no-arg compiler plugin

invokeInitializers.x-intellij-html-description: Whether to call initializers in the synthesized constructor. By default, initializers are not called.
invokeInitializers.title: Whether to call initializers in the synthesized constructor. By default, initializers are not called

x-intellij-enum-metadata.jpa: Automatically adds no-arg constructors to JPA entity classes

presets.x-intellij-html-description: Predefined sets of annotations. Currently only 'jpa' preset is supported, which automatically includes JPA entity annotations.
presets.title: Predefined sets of annotations. Currently only 'jpa' preset is supported, which automatically includes JPA entity annotations

enabled.x-intellij-html-description: Enables the kotlinx.serialization compiler plugin, which generates code based on @Serializable annotations. This also automatically adds the kotlinx-serialization-core library to provide the annotations and facilities for serialization, but no specific serialization format.
enabled.title: Enables the kotlinx.serialization compiler plugin, which generates code based on @Serializable annotations. This also automatically adds the kotlinx-serialization-core library to provide the annotations and facilities for serialization, but no specific serialization format

anyOf.x-intellij-html-description: The [kotlinx.serialization format](https://github.com/Kotlin/kotlinx.serialization/blob/master/formats/README.md) to use, such as `json`. When set, the corresponding `kotlinx-serialization-<format>` library is automatically added to dependencies. When null, no format dependency is automatically added. Prefer using the built-in catalog dependencies for this, as it gives control over the 'scope' and 'exported' properties.
anyOf.title: The kotlinx.serialization format to use, such as `json`. When set, the corresponding `kotlinx-serialization-<format>` library is automatically added to dependencies. When null, no format dependency is automatically added. Prefer using the built-in catalog dependencies for this, as it gives control over the 'scope' and 'exported' properties

version.x-intellij-html-description: The version of the kotlinx.serialization core and format libraries to use.
version.title: The version of the kotlinx.serialization core and format libraries to use

allWarningsAsErrors.x-intellij-html-description: Turn any warnings into a compilation error
allWarningsAsErrors.title: Turn any warnings into a compilation error

apiVersion.x-intellij-html-description: Allow using declarations only from the specified version of Kotlin bundled libraries
apiVersion.title: Allow using declarations only from the specified version of Kotlin bundled libraries

debug.x-intellij-html-description: (Only for [native targets](https://kotlinlang.org/docs/native-target-support.html)) Enable emitting debug information. Enabled in debug variants by default.
debug.title: Enable emitting debug information. Enabled in debug variants by default

languageVersion.x-intellij-html-description: Source compatibility with the specified version of Kotlin
languageVersion.title: Source compatibility with the specified version of Kotlin

optIns.x-intellij-html-description: Usages of API that [requires opt-in](https://kotlinlang.org/docs/opt-in-requirements.html) with a requirement annotation with the given fully qualified name
optIns.title: Usages of API that requires opt-in with a requirement annotation with the given fully qualified name

optimization.x-intellij-html-description: (Only for [native targets](https://kotlinlang.org/docs/native-target-support.html)) Enable compilation optimizations and produce a binary with better runtime performance. Enabled in release variants by default.
optimization.title: Enable compilation optimizations and produce a binary with better runtime performance. Enabled in release variants by default

progressiveMode.title: Enable the progressive mode for the compiler

suppressWarnings.x-intellij-html-description: Suppress the compiler from displaying warnings during compilation
suppressWarnings.title: Suppress the compiler from displaying warnings during compilation

verbose.x-intellij-html-description: Enable verbose logging output which includes details of the compilation process
verbose.title: Enable verbose logging output which includes details of the compilation process

entryPoint.title: The fully-qualified name of the application's entry point function

name.title: Artifact ID of the published Maven artifact
